messages.content: adding a 4th one to guardian is just irresponsible
Oh yeah we have 3 lmao
Defect Auto Boss Auto
defect auto boss guardian
It's boss auto
Guardian is whirl
Onyx is both very powerful and very fun, maybe the most fun single card in Downfall for me
Also clears the downside off your Overload+
In addition to the ones already mentioned
Orange Pellets has a finite number of uses per fight because you run out of powers; almost certainly the fact that no infinitely reusable debuff clearing exists in the base game is intentional
Downfall just cheerfully breaks that restriction and I appreciate it for that
Defect in the corner be like :watcherthink:
Ironclad in the corner be like :flawed:
Silent and watcher are just :dead:  tho
(Sure, you can creative AI for more powers, that comes up, Dual Wield for more powers too I suppose but not as often)
https://discord.com/channels/669242017427226638/1171177883868344451/1176615624995242056 for like the 1 person who hasnt seen it yet the vote is here
Dual wield is usually solid for a couple of powers or just mummy hand abuse
But you have to go a bit out of the way, it doesn't just jump up and down in front of you and say "I am infinite scaling, use me as many times as you like" the way Onyx does
Oh yeah of course not
That's a common theme, base game _can_ get as broken as Downfall but multiple things have to line up and you have to go out of your way, whereas in Downfall it is like every run
double nightmare can also do it
but I wouldn't say any of the characters in base game have an entire temp buff archetype
They really only have self debuffs more often than not
IC's Berserk S Wraith Form D Biased Cognition W Fasting
There's nuance to it but usually those
(Notice how all of these are powers lmao)

me likey
very original comment btw
Yeah this gem is really nice, debuff clearing is nice. I'll be honest I can socket this in just about anything and be fine with it though (I said just about, so don't be funny and say "roll attack")
Wanna scale strength? This is your friend. Dex? This is your friend. Thorns? This is your friend. Remove weak/vuln/frail? This is your friend. Make the Chosen a pushover? This is your friend.
This card is your friend.

This is a really useful rare, it's pretty much always going to make your deck better, but there are plenty of times where you need what another rare is offering more after beating an act boss. Guardian notably has very high quality rares, some of which can provide great frontloading or acceleration that are hard to replace. Onyx is very nice to have, and typically provides low effort repeatable scaling, but can be somewhat low impact in comparison. Socketing it after emerald/ruby inside a card with multiple sockets is tremendously powerful (especially if you use one of the two prismatic cards to put all 3 together), and you can easily recur the effect to create a mini demon form/dexterity form with reroute and recover for very good scaling. Beyond that, there are plenty of fights in the game like snecko, chosen, spire growth, tri-slavers, lagavulin, gremlin nob, etc, where an enemy relies on debuffing you to be threatening. Onyx tucked inside any socket card can provide some really nice value to help clear those debuffs and even the playing field, especially if you have something like future plans or runic pyramid to hold onto it for the right moment. Scaling your own thorns with tourmaline or piercing hide is fun, but not that powerful considering you only get to keep 1 stack.

I'm not a huge fan of taking this blind, you really want to already have 2 or more ruby/emerald, or other sources of temporary debuffs to clear. If it was from building up rare chance, then I nearly always take onyx speculatively, but buying it from a shop or picking it over other rares at a boss reward is rough if you don't have synergies already. Giga beam, ancient power, overload, flex/speed potion, are other relevant debuffs you can clear, and runic pyramid can make lining them up with your onyx much easier.
What rare accelerate cards are hard to replace? The only ones are <speed boost> and <time sifter>. Both are not that hard to replace.

embeds.title: Speed Boost
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

 (**Retain**.)
**Accelerate** 3 times.

embeds.title: Time Sifter
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

 (**Innate**.)
At the start of your turn, **Accelerate.**

messages.content: Acceleration more in the sense of helping you get online more quickly (card draw, energy gain, consistency). Stasis engine and citrine are both great ways to deploy your cards more quickly. Speed boost is also a very useful tool for getting your cards out of stasis quickly and setting yourself up in fights faster. I think that guardian has so many different ways to scale up over time that I don't really worry about finding one, since they're all quite useful. The more common way you lose as guardian is by having a deck that is too slow to get setup and dies before it really gets online, so I really value having tools to speed that process up. I essentially consider stasis to be a form of card draw and energy gain (especially accelerate effects).
Ah, I was confused with the word choice
I still think speed boost is pretty bad

I've had good success with it in decks that can fill up stasis slots very quickly (planning, reroute, recover, orb support, future plans, stasis field), especially when I don't have any ways to make additional stasis slots.
